ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Should definitely take it if you are a first-year history PhD student. Speak in class.

This is a perfect class for a first year student. It is also the best way for a student to know more about different fields of history and the history department at Yale. I will recommend this class to others.
I would highly recommend it to every graduate student in her/his first year.
HIST 500 is a great class to understand different ways of writing history and to get to know the faculty and their fields. Definitely something that I would recommend.

History 500 is reading seminar that introduces us to the Yale history faculty and the various approaches that they take to become the scholars that they are. I would recommend it for students who are interested in reading broadly and getting to know fields outside their area of interest.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Like a map/tour guide. Truly enlightening. Offers strong motivation to be a historian.
This class broadened my horizon. It gave me many inspirations and showed me many fields which I knew nothing about before.

History 500 gave me a good overview over the different ways to write, but also to understand history. It was a great introduction in very specific, very diverse fields and it thereby provided a good grounding for an open-minded understanding of the discipline.
The course gave me some ideas on connecting different regions and time periods thematically . It also helped me think of new ways to do historical research that I had not considered before.
